info.title: Blackbaud Raisers Edge NXT Fun
info.description: Blackbaud Raiser's Edge NXT is a comprehensive cloud-based fundraising and donor management software solution built specifically for nonprofits and the entire social good community. Use the Fundraising connector to manage campaigns, funds, appeals, and packages.

get.description: Lists the appeals for a constituent.

parameters.name: constituent_id
parameters.description: The system record ID of the constituent.

400.description: Returned when the specified constituent ID in the request URL is not in the appropriate format.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to view the constituent appeals.

404.description: Returned when the specified constituent is not found.

get.description: Returns a list of appeals.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Represents the number of records to return. The default is 500. The maximum is 5000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Represents the number of records to skip. For use with pagination.

parameters.name: include_inactive
parameters.description: Include inactive appeals?

parameters.name: date_added
parameters.description: Filter the results to appeals created on or after the specified date (ex: '2020-09-18T04:13:56Z').

parameters.name: last_modified
parameters.description: Filter the results to appeals modified on or after the specified date (ex: '2020-09-18T04:13:56Z').

400.description: Returned when the specified request parameters are not in the appropriate format.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to view the appeals.

get.description: Returns information about an appeal.

parameters.name: appeal_id
parameters.description: The system record ID of the appeal to get.

400.description: Returned when the specified appeal ID in the request URL is not in the appropriate format.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to view the appeal.

404.description: Returned when the specified appeal is not found.

parameters.name: appeal_id
parameters.description: The system record ID of the appeal.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to view the attachments.

404.description: Returned when the specified appeal is not found.

get.description: Lists the custom fields for an appeal.

parameters.name: appeal_id
parameters.description: The system record ID of the appeal.

400.description: Returned when the specified appeal ID in the request URL is not in the appropriate format.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to view the custom fields.

404.description: Returned when the specified appeal is not found.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An object that represents the attachment to create.

200.description: Returned when the operation successfully creates an attachment. The response body contains the ID of the new attachment.

400.description: Returned when the request body is not in the appropriate format.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to create the attachment.

404.description: Returned when the specified appeal is not found.

parameters.name: attachment_id
parameters.description: The system record ID of the attachment to update.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An object that represents the properties of the attachment to update.

200.description: Returned when the operation successfully updates the attachment.

400.description: Returned when the specified attachment ID in the request URL or the specified request parameters are not in the appropriate format.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to update the attachment.

404.description: Returned when the specified attachment is not found.

post.description: Creates a new appeal custom field.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An object that represents the custom field to create.

200.description: Returned when the operation successfully creates a custom field. The response body contains the ID of the new custom field.

400.description: Returned when the request body is not in the appropriate format.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to create the custom field.

404.description: Returned when the specified appeal is not found.

parameters.name: custom_field_id
parameters.description: The system record ID of the custom field to update.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An object that represents the properties of the custom field to update.

200.description: Returned when the operation successfully updates the custom field.

400.description: Returned when the specified custom field ID in the request URL or the specified request parameters are not in the appropriate format.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to update the custom field.

404.description: Returned when the specified custom field is not found.

get.description: Lists the appeal custom field categories.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to view custom field categories.

get.description: Returns a list of packages.

parameters.name: appeal_id
parameters.description: Represents a comma-separated list of appeal system record IDs to filter the results. For example, "506,918" returns only packages for appeal 506 or appeal 918.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Represents the number of records to return. The default is 500. The maximum is 5000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Represents the number of records to skip. For use with pagination.

parameters.name: include_inactive
parameters.description: Include inactive packages?

parameters.name: date_added
parameters.description: Filter the results to packages created on or after the specified date (ex: '2020-09-18T04:13:56Z').

parameters.name: last_modified
parameters.description: Filter the results to packages modified on or after the specified date (ex: '2020-09-18T04:13:56Z').

400.description: Returned when the specified request parameters are not in the appropriate format.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to view the packages.

count.description: The number of items available for retrieval into the collection after applying any request parameters. The limit and offset parameters do not affect the count, but to facilitate paging, they may affect the number of items in the value result set.

value.description: The set of items included in the response. This may be a subset of the items in the collection.

FundraisingApi.AppealAttachmentAdd.description: Many cultivation activities collect related collateral, such as correspondence and prospect research. Attachments can save this data on the appropriate record to maintain a complete view of those activities.

parent_id.description: The system record ID of the appeal associated with the attachment.

type.description: The attachment type. Physical attachments are uploaded files such as images, PDFs, or Word documents that are saved locally or on the network. They are stored and managed in the system. Link attachments are links to files such as images, blog posts, or YouTube videos that are online or in a cloud storage account. They are stored and managed externally.

name.description: The name of the attachment. Character limit: 150.

date.description: The date of the attachment (ex: '2020-09-18T04:13:56Z'). This field defaults to the current date and time if not supplied.

url.description: The URL for the attachment. This is required for link attachments and not applicable for physical attachments.

file_name.description: The name of the file. Character limit: 36. For physical attachments only.

file_id.description: The identifier of the file. Character limit: 36. For physical attachments only.

thumbnail_id.description: The identifier of the thumbnail. Character limit: 36. For physical attachments only.

tags.description: The tags associated with the attachment.

FundraisingApi.AppealAttachmentEdit.description: Many cultivation activities collect related collateral, such as correspondence and prospect research. Attachments can save this data on the appropriate record to maintain a complete view of those activities.

name.description: The name of the attachment. Character limit: 150.

url.description: The URL for the attachment. This is required for link attachments and not applicable for physical attachments.

tags.description: The tags associated with the attachment.

id.description: The system record ID of the attachment.

parent_id.description: The system record ID of the appeal associated with the attachment.

type.description: The attachment type. Physical attachments are uploaded files such as images, PDFs, or Word documents that are saved locally or on the network. They are stored and managed in the system. Link attachments are links to files such as images, blog posts, or YouTube videos that are online or in a cloud storage account. They are stored and managed externally.

name.description: The name of the attachment. Character limit: 150.

url.description: The URL for the attachment. This is required for link attachments and not applicable for physical attachments.

file_name.description: The name of the file. Character limit: 36. For physical attachments only.

file_id.description: The identifier of the file. Character limit: 36. For physical attachments only.

thumbnail_id.description: The identifier of the thumbnail. Character limit: 36. For physical attachments only.

thumbnail_url.description: The URL for a thumbnail. For physical attachments that are images only. Contains a time-bound signature that limits access to 60 minutes.

content_type.description: The content type. For physical attachments only.

file_size.description: The file size in bytes. For physical attachments only.

tags.description: The tags associated with the attachment.

FundraisingApi.AppealCustomFieldAdd.description: While records provide many fields to track information, organizations often require additional details. To track this specialized information, use custom fields.

parent_id.description: The system record ID of the appeal associated with the custom field.

date.description: The date on the custom field (ex: '2005-09-18').

comment.description: The comment on the custom field. Character limit: 50.

FundraisingApi.AppealCustomFieldEdit.description: While records provide many fields to track information, organizations often require additional details. To track this specialized information, use custom fields.

category.description: The custom field category (required if updating the custom field value).

date.description: The date on the custom field (ex: '2005-09-18').

comment.description: The comment on the custom field. Character limit: 50.

id.description: The system record ID of the custom field.

parent_id.description: The system record ID of the appeal associated with the custom field.

type.description: The type of data that the custom field represents.

value.description: The value of the custom field.

text_value.description: The text value of the custom field.

number_value.description: The numeric value of the custom field.

date_value.description: The date value of the custom field.

currency_value.description: The currency value of the custom field.

boolean_value.description: The boolean value of the custom field.

codetableentry_value.description: The table entry value of the custom field.

constituentid_value.description: The constituent ID value of the custom field.

fuzzydate_value.description: The fuzzy date value of the custom field.

d.description: The day in the fuzzy date.

m.description: The month in the fuzzy date.

y.description: The year in the fuzzy date.

date.description: The date on the custom field.

comment.description: The comment on the custom field. Character limit: 50.

date_added.description: The date when the custom field was created.

date_modified.description: The date when the custom field was last modified.

id.description: The system record ID of the appeal.

date_added.description: The date when the appeal was created.

date_modified.description: The date when the appeal was last modified.

description.description: The display name of the appeal.

end_date.description: The end date of the appeal.

goal.description: The monetary goal associated with the appeal.

value.description: The monetary value.

inactive.description: Is the appeal active (meaning, the current date is after any start date and before any end date)?

lookup_id.description: The user-defined identifier for the appeal.

start_date.description: The start date of the appeal.

FundraisingApi.CampaignAttachmentAdd.description: Many cultivation activities collect related collateral, such as correspondence and prospect research. Attachments can save this data on the appropriate record to maintain a complete view of those activities.

parent_id.description: The system record ID of the campaign associated with the attachment.

type.description: The attachment type. Physical attachments are uploaded files such as images, PDFs, or Word documents that are saved locally or on the network. They are stored and managed in the system. Link attachments are links to files such as images, blog posts, or YouTube videos that are online or in a cloud storage account. They are stored and managed externally.

name.description: The name of the attachment. Character limit: 150.

date.description: The date of the attachment (ex: '2020-09-18T04:13:56Z'). This field defaults to the current date and time if not supplied.

url.description: The URL for the attachment. This is required for link attachments and not applicable for physical attachments.

file_name.description: The name of the file. Character limit: 36. For physical attachments only.

file_id.description: The identifier of the file. Character limit: 36. For physical attachments only.

thumbnail_id.description: The identifier of the thumbnail. Character limit: 36. For physical attachments only.

tags.description: The tags associated with the attachment.

tags.description: The tags associated with the attachment.

id.description: The system record ID of the attachment.

parent_id.description: The system record ID of the campaign associated with the attachment.

type.description: The attachment type. Physical attachments are uploaded files such as images, PDFs, or Word documents that are saved locally or on the network. They are stored and managed in the system. Link attachments are links to files such as images, blog posts, or YouTube videos that are online or in a cloud storage account. They are stored and managed externally.

name.description: The name of the attachment. Character limit: 150.

url.description: The URL for the attachment. This is required for link attachments and not applicable for physical attachments.

file_name.description: The name of the file. Character limit: 36. For physical attachments only.

file_id.description: The identifier of the file. Character limit: 36. For physical attachments only.

thumbnail_id.description: The identifier of the thumbnail. Character limit: 36. For physical attachments only.

thumbnail_url.description: The URL for a thumbnail. For physical attachments that are images only. Contains a time-bound signature that limits access to 60 minutes.

content_type.description: The content type. For physical attachments only.

file_size.description: The file size in bytes. For physical attachments only.

tags.description: The tags associated with the attachment.

FundraisingApi.CampaignCustomFieldAdd.description: While records provide many fields to track information, organizations often require additional details. To track this specialized information, use custom fields.

parent_id.description: The system record ID of the campaign associated with the custom field.

date.description: The date on the custom field (ex: '2005-09-18').

comment.description: The comment on the custom field. Character limit: 50.

FundraisingApi.CustomFieldCategoryRead.description: The system includes many different types of custom fields. Custom field categories store the metadata to appropriately match how you use a given custom field with an available type.

name.description: The name of the custom field category.

type.description: The type of data that custom fields with this category represent.

FundraisingApi.FundraiserAssignmentAdd.description: Fundraiser constituents interact with other constituents on behalf of your organization to cultivate relationships and request donations. Fundraiser assignments allow you to assign specific constituents to fundraisers for solicitation purposes.

fundraiser_id.description: The system record ID of the fundraiser.

constituent_id.description: The system record ID of the assigned constituent.

start.description: The start date of the assignment (ex: '2020-09-18T04:13:56Z').

end.description: The end date of the assignment (ex: '2020-09-18T04:13:56Z').

value.description: The goal amount for the fundraiser to solicit from the assigned constituent.

campaign_id.description: The system record ID of the campaign to which which resulting gifts will be applied.

fund_id.description: The system record ID of the fund to which which resulting gifts will be applied.

appeal_id.description: The system record ID of the appeal to which which resulting gifts will be applied.

id.description: The system record ID of the fundraiser assignment.

constituent_id.description: The system record ID of the assigned constituent.

start.description: The start date of the assignment.

end.description: The end date of the assignment.

amount.description: The goal amount for the fundraiser to solicit from the assigned constituent.

value.description: The monetary value.

campaign_id.description: The system record ID of the campaign to which which resulting gifts will be applied.

fund_id.description: The system record ID of the fund to which which resulting gifts will be applied.

appeal_id.description: The system record ID of the appeal to which which resulting gifts will be applied.

FundraisingApi.FundAttachmentAdd.description: Many cultivation activities collect related collateral, such as correspondence and prospect research. Attachments can save this data on the appropriate record to maintain a complete view of those activities.

parent_id.description: The system record ID of the fund associated with the attachment.

type.description: The attachment type. Physical attachments are uploaded files such as images, PDFs, or Word documents that are saved locally or on the network. They are stored and managed in the system. Link attachments are links to files such as images, blog posts, or YouTube videos that are online or in a cloud storage account. They are stored and managed externally.

name.description: The name of the attachment. Character limit: 150.

date.description: The date of the attachment (ex: '2020-09-18T04:13:56Z'). This field defaults to the current date and time if not supplied.

url.description: The URL for the attachment. This is required for link attachments and not applicable for physical attachments.

file_name.description: The name of the file. Character limit: 36. For physical attachments only.

file_id.description: The identifier of the file. Character limit: 36. For physical attachments only.

thumbnail_id.description: The identifier of the thumbnail. Character limit: 36. For physical attachments only.

tags.description: The tags associated with the attachment.

NXTDataIntegrationApi.ConstituentAppealC.description: A constituent appeal represents a record of an appeal sent to a constituent.

constituent_id.description: The system record ID of the constituent associated with the constituent appeal.

appeal_description.description: The appeal description; used to look up the appeal record ID.

package_description.description: The package description; used to look up the package record ID.

appeal_date.description: The date for the constituent appeal (ex: '2005-09-18').

response_description.description: The long description of the response for the constituent appeal.

marketing_segment.description: The marketing segment associated with the constituent appeal.

marketing_source_code.description: The marketing source code associated with the constituent appeal.

mailing_id.description: The mailing ID of the constituent appeal.

market_finder_number.description: The market finder number associated with the constituent appeal.

comments.description: The comments associated with the constituent appeal.

import_id.description: The import ID of the constituent appeal.
